page.title: 20Transport
page.content: Between 1856 and 1951 LINDEAN people enjoyed the facilities of a branch railway line connecting with the Border Union Railway,later renamed the Waverley Route ,at Galashiels. In 1921 the first motor bus service in the South of Scotland was launched by a Galashiels motorist.It plied between Galashiels and Selkirk and was so successful that it attracted other pioneers and the interest of the Scottish Motor Traction Company of Edinburgh,with which it merged.The merger formed the basis of the Scottish Transport Group,one of whose members-Lowland Scottish-administers local services.Almost every householder owns a car/cars.Summary of bus routes (journeys/year) Edinburgh - Carlisle(5980),Galashiels-Selkirk (4368),Edinburgh-London(365).
